result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob Anthony Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute Sobriety.
Not to have contact with ZE unless modified by probation.  
Not to have contact with TTN unless modified by probation.  
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting.
Not to possess of anyone else's personal identifying information/documents without their permission.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 21CF151, 21CF540 & 22CF7.  11:23 AM Defendant Jacob A Smith in court with attorney Donna Burger.  Defendant Jacob A Smith in custody.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk
21CF151-Count 1 AMENDED to misd poss amphetamine 961.41(3g)(d)-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
Count 2-DRI
22CF7-Count 1-obstructing-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
Count 5-misd bail jumping-NC plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
All other counts DRI
21CF540-DRI

SENTENCE: 
21CF151-Count 1-poss amphet-w/h, probation 2 yrs.  AODA.  AS.  Not to have contact with users/dealers.  Not to have contact with ZE unless modified by probation.  May have contact with TTN but that may be modified by probation.  No possession of others identifying documents without their permission.
60 days CT-subj to WR, no GT-stayed.  20 days credit, DNA sample, $200 surcharge, no fine.  60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.

22CF7-
Count 1-obstructing-w/h, probation 2 yrs.  AODA.  AS.  Not to have contact with users/dealers.  Not to have contact with ZE unless modified by probation.  May have contact with TTN but that may be modified by probation.  No possession of others identifying documents without their permission.
12 days credit.  DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $265.60 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.

Count 5-bail jump-w/h, probation 2 yrs.  AODA.  AS.  Not to have contact with users/dealers.  Not to have contact with ZE unless modified by probation.  May have contact with TTN but that may be modified by probation.  No possession of others identifying documents without their permission.
DNA sample, $200 surcharge, no fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment.

PCR.  11:51 am adj.

CASES: 21CF540 & 22CF7 Defendant Jacob Anthony Smith appears by video means, in custody.  Benjamin James Webster appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2:48 pm CH-Clerk DE waives PH. Ct. accepts waivers. Ct. finds PC, DE bound over for trial.  ARGN: Reading waived, NG pleas entered, preserved 15 days on prearraingment rights. Bond continues. 2:55 pm adj.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
COVERS CASES 22CF07 & 21CF540. Absolute Sobriety.  Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to use or possess any one else's personal documents or identification.

CASES: INIT in 22CF07 & RW in 21CF540. Defendant Jacob Anthony Smith appeared by video means from the Polk County Jail. Prosecuting Atty David Stilin appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Donna Burger appears in court. 1:02 p.m. AO-Clerk. Ct quashes warrant in 21CF540. 22CF07 - Atty Burger - de qualifies, waive reading. State requests $1500 cash bond. DSPH.  1:14 p.m. Defendant leaves video conference room at PCJ. 1:14 p.m. adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 18, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
